titles.title: A concurrent resolution supporting the International Decade for Natural Disaster Reduction by endorsing the establishment of a United States Decade for Natural Disaster Reduction.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Science, Space, and Technology.
Referred to Subcommittee on Science, Research and Technology.
Subcommittee on Science, Research and Technology Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported to House by House Committee on Science, Space, and Technology. Report No: 100-920.
Called up by House Under Suspension of Rules.
Resolution Agreed to in House by Voice Vote.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

bill.summary: 5/3/1988--Introduced. Declares that the Congress endorses the establishment of a United States Decade for Natural Disaster Reduction as a means of supporting the goal of the International Decade for Natural Disaster Reduction to enhance existing cooperative efforts and promote new cooperative efforts to reduce the devastating impact of natural hazards.
